meta.last_updated: After the Unfortunate Incident with Edition 16
meta.disclaimer: The Spellwick Adventurers' Guild accepts no liability for career choices made based on these specifications

warrior.survival_rate: 62% (higher if accompanied by a competent healer)

equipment_requirements.armor: As much metal as physically possible to wear while still maintaining mobility
equipment_requirements.weapons: At least one primary weapon with a dramatic name and backstory
equipment_requirements.accessories: Inexplicable pouches, battle trophies, emergency rations

role_functions.primary: Frontline combatant and tactical meat shield
role_functions.secondary: Triggering traps that somehow evaded the rogue's detection
role_functions.tertiary: Asking wizards to explain magical concepts then interrupting halfway through

Battle Cry.effect: 50% chance of intimidating enemies, 100% chance of alerting all enemies within earshot
Battle Cry.cooldown: Recovers after drinking one tankard of ale

Tactical Withdrawal.effect: Dignified retreat preserving the warrior's ego
Tactical Withdrawal.cooldown: Available whenever the healer suggests running away

Implausible Survival.effect: Survive lethal damage through sheer narrative necessity
Implausible Survival.cooldown: Once per tower raid, usable only when the plot requires it

advancement_path.novice: Young Hero With Something to Prove
advancement_path.expert: Grizzled Veteran with Improbable Survival Stories
advancement_path.master: Living Legend Whose Battle Stories Grow More Exaggerated With Each Retelling

common_causes_of_death: Overconfidence
Gravity
Attempting to engage in witty repartee with clearly superior intellects
Touching the glowing thing after being specifically told not to touch the glowing thing

mage.survival_rate: 41% (decreases dramatically when out of spell components)

equipment_requirements.components: Various pouches containing materials that inevitably spill at critical moments
equipment_requirements.accessories: At least one item that glows for no functional reason

role_functions.primary: Arcane artillery and walking magical encyclopedia
role_functions.secondary: Explaining why teleportation directly to the treasure room is impossible
role_functions.tertiary: Creating light sources that attract precisely the monsters the party was avoiding

Theoretical Solution.effect: Provide lengthy academic explanation of a problem without offering practical help
Theoretical Solution.cooldown: Available whenever someone asks 'Can't you just...?'

Convenient Amnesia.effect: Temporarily forget a useful spell that would solve the current problem too easily
Convenient Amnesia.cooldown: Recharges immediately after the crisis has been resolved through more complicated means

Actually Useful Spell.effect: Cast exactly the right spell for the situation
Actually Useful Spell.cooldown: Once per adventure, typically saved for the final confrontation

advancement_path.novice: Apprentice with More Theoretical Knowledge Than Practical Experience
advancement_path.intermediate: Spell Slinger with Suspiciously Singed Eyebrows
advancement_path.expert: Arcane Specialist with Increasingly Esoteric Research Interests
advancement_path.master: Theoretical Impossibility Expert Whose Name Is Whispered in Academic Circles

common_causes_of_death: Experimental spell miscalculation
Running out of spell components at critical moments
Curiosity about magical phenomena that should clearly be left alone
Accidentally summoning entities well above their management capabilities

primary_attributes: Ability to Remain Cheerful While Covered in Blood
healer.survival_rate: 73% (typically the last to die in a party wipe)

equipment_requirements.attire: Practical robes with inexplicable ability to repel most bodily fluids
equipment_requirements.supplies: Bandages, herbs, potions, and cookies with questionable ingredients
equipment_requirements.accessories: At least one holy symbol, whether relevant to their powers or not

role_functions.primary: Keeping the party alive despite their best efforts to the contrary
role_functions.secondary: Delivering lectures about safety while reattaching limbs
role_functions.tertiary: Maintaining group morale through a combination of encouragement and threats

Miraculous Recovery.effect: Restore a party member from the brink of death with a success rate directly proportional to how foolishly they ended up there
Miraculous Recovery.cooldown: Recharges after a solid night's sleep or an existential crisis, whichever comes first

Healing Cookie.effect: Provide medical treatment disguised as a tasty treat, with side effects ranging from mild hallucinations to temporary hair color changes

Guilt Trip.effect: Significantly reduce reckless behavior through the strategic deployment of disappointed sighs
Guilt Trip.cooldown: Effectiveness decreases with repeated use on the same target

advancement_path.master: Living Saint with Disturbing Interest in Rare Injuries

common_causes_of_death: Self-sacrifice to save ungrateful party members
Exhaustion from overextending healing capabilities
Forgetting to heal themselves while focusing on others
Being targeted first by intelligent enemies who understand tactical priorities

rogue.survival_rate: 67% (decreases dramatically when caught stealing from party members)

equipment_requirements.attire: Dark clothing with an impractical number of hidden pockets
equipment_requirements.tools: Lockpicks with sentimental names and individualized cases
equipment_requirements.accessories: At least three concealed weapons and one concealed snack

role_functions.primary: Trap detection, lock manipulation, and tactical acquisitions
role_functions.tertiary: Explaining why certain items mysteriously vanished

Convenient Shadow.effect: Become suddenly unavailable when manual labor is required
Convenient Shadow.cooldown: Resets immediately after work is complete

Selective Honesty.effect: Tell the exact truth in a way that conveys a complete falsehood

Trap Sense.effect: Detect traps with 95% accuracy, with failures occurring primarily when the warrior is directly behind
Trap Sense.cooldown: Refreshes after someone says 'I told you so'

advancement_path.novice: Suspicious Character with Basic Pickpocketing Skills
advancement_path.intermediate: Security Consultant with Morally Ambiguous Past
advancement_path.expert: Master of Infiltration with Impressive Collection of 'Souvenirs'
advancement_path.master: Shadow Legend Whose Exploits Are Known But Can Never Be Proven

common_causes_of_death: Overconfidence in trap-disarming abilities
Stealing from the wrong person/entity
Looking back to gloat while fleeing
Betrayed by fellow rogues in competing thieves' guilds

primary_attributes: Ability to Calculate Trajectory While Being Punched
battle_mathematician.survival_rate: 84% (highest among specialized classes due to excellent risk assessment)

equipment_requirements.attire: Practical armor with formula engravings and reinforced spectacle attachments
equipment_requirements.weapons: Precisely balanced for optimal force application
equipment_requirements.accessories: Calculation tools, tactical journals, and emergency statistical reference charts

role_functions.tertiary: Explaining to warriors why their intuitive approach is statistically flawed

Calculated Strike.effect: Attack with precision based on complex mathematical formulas, dealing damage inversely proportional to the target's understanding of algebra

Statistical Analysis.effect: Determine the optimal course of action with 98.4% accuracy (Â±2.7% margin of error)
Statistical Analysis.cooldown: Available at will, but effectiveness decreases under pressure

Primal Algorithm.effect: Temporarily abandon rational calculation for instinctive battle rage, with effectiveness proportional to how long they've been suppressing the urge to simply hit things
Primal Algorithm.cooldown: Requires reestablishing mathematical discipline through meditation

advancement_path.novice: Formula Student with Theoretical Combat Models
advancement_path.expert: Combat Statistician with Published Papers on Applied Violence Mathematics
advancement_path.master: Living Calculator with Perfect Combat Efficiency Record

common_causes_of_death: Analysis paralysis during dynamic combat situations
Failure to account for chaotic variables (typically introduced by party members)
Overreliance on models that don't account for reality's inherent absurdity
Being targeted by enemies who recognize their tactical importance

bard_warlock.survival_rate: Unknown (survivors tend to return with different personalities)

equipment_requirements.attire: Eclectic combination of fashions from different eras and realms
equipment_requirements.instruments: Seemingly ordinary items that occasionally emit unsettling sounds when not being played
equipment_requirements.accessories: Collection of trinkets that appear worthless but have deep personal significance

role_functions.primary: Social interaction specialist and information gatherer
role_functions.secondary: Provider of cryptically specific knowledge about current situations
role_functions.tertiary: Source of unsettling but ultimately useful connections

Convenient Revelation.effect: Reveal critical information about the current scenario that there's no logical way they could know
Convenient Revelation.cooldown: Available whenever the party is truly stuck

Patron's Whisper.effect: Hear cryptic advice from entities beyond conventional reality, with clarity inversely proportional to urgency
Patron's Whisper.cooldown: Active during celestial alignments and moments of extreme danger

Reality Bent.effect: Briefly alter local reality through performance, with results ranging from helpful to horrifying
Reality Bent.cooldown: Available once per tower, with recovery time proportional to how many natural laws were violated

advancement_path.novice: Peculiar Performer with Occasional Prophetic Episodes
advancement_path.intermediate: Cosmic Negotiator with Growing Shadow Collection
advancement_path.expert: Reality's Acquaintance with Increasingly Concerning Knowledge
advancement_path.master: Walking Paradox Whose True Nature Is Best Left Unexamined

common_causes_of_death: Contractual obligations to entities beyond conventional understanding
Reality rejection after learning too many cosmic truths
Technically still alive but existing simultaneously across multiple timelines
Not actually dead but transformed into something adjacent to conventional life

special_considerations.too_many_warriors: Will solve immediate monster problems but become trapped by basic puzzles
special_considerations.too_many_mages: Excessive theoretical knowledge with insufficient practical application capabilities
special_considerations.too_many_rogues: Exponentially increasing probability of betrayal and mysterious inventory shrinkage
special_considerations.no_healer: Significantly reduced survival expectations and increased resurrection service costs
special_considerations.including_bard_warlock: Unpredictable but potentially advantageous; maintain active exit strategy

party_composition_guidelines.party_dynamics_notes: Party effectiveness correlates less with individual capabilities and more with their ability to prevent each other from acting on their worst impulses
